summary: Combines enchantments of guild armors into a necklace to allow for stand alone armor use.
descriptionHtml:
Introduction:
Ever want to wear standalone armors yet feel conflicted about wanting the bonuses from your guild
armor? Faction Amulets seeks to rectify this by giving you all the stats of
faction armors and putting them into a single enchantment on a piece of jewelry.
Your faction affinity will be also be preserved! This mod is intended to save
you from having to enchant your armor. Using this mod and enchanted armor is
extremely overpowered, but each to their own.

Factions Covered:
Mages College
Companions
Thieves Guild
Nightingales
Dark Brotherhood
Cicero

Methodology:
The first tier amulet represents the armor that you could expect to get from joining an organization.
The second tier represents the rewards befitting the completion of a guild quest
line. And the third represents the apex suitable for end game content.
I used the ancient dark brotherhood armor, upgraded thieves armor, and max leveled nightingale to get
an idea for potency of the tiers. I took the combined stats and made a single enchantment.
The creation kit was kind enough to weight the value of all the pieces to give
a sense of how powerful the enchantment was. I then added an appropriate bonus
enchantment(s) to represent the amulet that would otherwise be worn.

Tier One: 2500-3500
Tier Two: 4000-6000
Tier Three: 7500-8000

So the tier one nightingale amulet includes all of the enchants of the level 37+ enchantments, dark
brotherhood back stab, and fortify marksmanship 25. The other two tiers have
essentially the same stats just scaled up.

Lastly, a lot of the value on these items may not affect your character play style at all. But rather than
make a million different amulets I just made a few that cover pretty much
everything and let you have the flexibility to benefit from what you use and
ignore the stats you don't bother with.

For example:
I assume that if you’re a companion you'll use either heavy or light armor exclusively, that you'll use
weapons governed by two perk trees primarily, you'll be trying to blocking
melee attacks, and that you'll be using shouts.

Tier one companions amulet is roughly 3500 worth of stats covering: Archery, One-Hand, Block, Light Armor,
Shout Reduction, Stamina Regen, some magic resist, and Hit Points. Yet the amulet also has heavy armor and two
handed weapons included.

Why max level items:
First, vanilla armor enchantments feel underwhelming to me. Second, the real life time invested into
the quests is of equal worth to me regardless if I've been playing the
character for a few hours or several weeks.
author: Kaiezo
